6 bytes ( Signal byte1, Signal byte2, Offset byte1, Offset byte2, PHASE byte1, PHASE byte2)

Receiver reply payload: 1 or 3 byte (‘o’, Zcoarse byte1, Zcoarse byte2) OR (‘f’)

Vmax*4 bytes - [actuator_direct_adc_measurement byte 1, actuator_direct_adc_measurement byte 2, actuator_indirect_adc_measurement byte 1, actuator_indirect_adc_measurement byte 2]*4096 values (ADC measurements per DAC level)

Send payload: 12 bytes (a, b, c) – fitted quadratic polynomial coefficients for direct p-v relation (single precision floating point)
12 bytes (d, e, f) – fitted quadratic polynomial coefficients for coupling r-v relation (single precision floating point)
11 bytes (‘@’, vmin_line byte 1, vmin_line byte2, vmin_scan byte 1, vmin_scan byte 2, vmax byte 1, vmax byte 2, numpts byte 1, numpts byte 2, numlines byte 1, numlines byte 2)

Receiver reply payload: 8 points of 6 bytes each: (z_offset_adc byte 1, z_offset_adc byte 2, z_amp_adc byte 1, z_amp_adc byte 2, z_phase_adc byte 1, z_phase_adc byte 2))

Send payload: Channel byte enum: z: Zoffset, a: Amplitude, g: x1, h: x2, i: y1, j: y2

Remark: MCU sends this ID when it receives a command it does not recognize. Check firmware/client version.
